Section Header: <center> Consent Document
Field Label: FW Full Name

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Title: Multi-Level and Intersectional Stigma and Other Social Determinant Effects on TB Case Detection, Care, and Treatment Outcomes: The MISSED TB Outcomes Study
Sponsor: U.S. National Institutes of Health
Co-Principal Investigators: Dr Andrew Medina-Marino, PhD, Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF)
Dr. Aaron M. Kipp, PhD, East Carolina University
Address: Desmond Tutu HIV Centre, University of Cape Town, Faculty of Health Sciences, Anzio Road, Observatory, 7700, Cape Town
Protocol Number: 543/2020 (Human Research Ethics Committee, University of Cape Town)

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Informed Consent Form: TB Index Patient Household Contact Investigation

Good morning/afternoon. My name is [tbip_sc_staff_full_name] and I work for the Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF). We would like to invite you to take part in a study we are doing in collaboration with the Eastern Cape Department of Health. The focus of this study is on tuberculosis (TB), which is a very serious problem in South Africa and the Eastern Cape.

Our study aims to identify and understand how individual and community knowledge, beliefs and social norms influence TB-related care and health outcomes. You have been approached to participate because you are an index TB patient with household contacts.

This consent form contains details about the study and what will be expected of you if you agree to participate. Before you agree to take part in the study, you should fully understand why this study is being done. I will go through this consent form with you, and make sure that you understand what the study is all about. If there is anything that you do not understand, please ask me to stop and I will explain it to you. If you have any other questions related to this study, please feel free to ask me.

PURPOSE OF THE STUDY
We are conducting the survey for two main reasons:
1. To identify and understand how individual and community knowledge, beliefs and social norms influence TB-related care and health outcomes

2. To inform possible ways to improve TB and TB/HIV health outcomes among those with TB or TB/HIV

STUDY PROCEDURES
If you agree to participate, you will first be asked to sign this consent form or make your thumb print mark to show that you are willing to take part in the study. After you agree to be part of our study, we will work with you to create a map and set of directions to your house. We will also create a detailed list of who lives with you, their contact information, and days that they can usually be found at home. After which, we will schedule a time and day that works best with your household contacts to visit them and screen them for TB. If they screen positive then we will also invite them to participate in the study.

CONFIDENTIALITY
Your participation in this study will be kept confidential. We will not tell anyone about your participation; we will make every effort to protect your privacy, confidentiality, answers, and information. Your household information will be stored either on a secure, password protected computer, or in a cabinet that will be kept locked at all times in our study office. We will identify you and your household using a special number that will be assigned to you by a computer. Only authorised research staff will know what your special number is or be able to see your information. After these five years, any personal identifying information you provide will be destroyed.

RISKS, BENEFITS, AND COSTS TO YOU
We understand that by visiting your home, you may feel the need to disclose your TB status to your household contacts. If you are taking this opportunity to disclose your status for the first time, we are aware that this may be a difficult conversation. This may cause you stress, and may even be stigmatizing. If this happens, please tell us immediately so that we can provide you with support and counselling. If we cannot provide you with the support you need, we will refer you to someone who can.

Although you will not directly benefit from participating, your household members will benefit from free TB screening. If anyone in your household screens positive for signs and symptoms of TB, we will immediately refer them to the clinic for testing. Participation in this study will involve no cost to you, and you will not be paid to participate in this study. If you decide to not participate, your care or the care of your household members will not be affected.

WITHDRAWAL FROM THE STUDY
Participation in this survey is voluntary, you do not need to participate if you do not want to. You can choose to not have the study team visit your house during the time leading up to the scheduled visits. You can still go to the clinic for services regardless of if you participate.

PROBLEMS OR QUESTIONS
If you ever have any questions or experience harm because of the study, please contact the Study Investigator Dr. Andrew Medina-Marino at 0826373793 or Andrew.Marino@hiv-research.org.za. This research has been approved by the University of Cape Town Human Research Ethics Committee (an independent committee established to help protect the rights of research participants). If you have any concerns about the way the study is being carried out, you may contact the committee chair, Dr. Marc Blockman, on 021 650 4015 or marc.blockman@uct.ac.za.  

DECLARATION TO PARTICIPATE


By signing below, I [tbip_sc_part_name] [tbip_sc_part_surname] consent voluntarily to participate in the study entitled: "Multi-Level and Intersectional Stigma and Other Social Determinant Effects on TB Case Detection, Care, and Treatment Outcomes: The MISSED TB Outcomes Study"

I declare that:
1) I have read this consent form or had it read to me.
2) I understand the aims of the research and have had an opportunity to ask questions.
3) I understand what my involvement in the study will entail and agree to participate.
4) I understand that I do not have to give any information that I am not comfortable sharing.
5) I understand that I can withdraw from the study at any point if I feel the need to.
6) By signing this form, I do not give up any rights that I have as a study participant.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Proceed to Consent

Section Header: SECTION 9: PATIENT/PROVIDER COMMUNICATION
Field Label:
RA Instruction:

Communication with patients is a very important part of quality medical care. We would like to know how you feel about the way your TB nurse communicated with you. Your answers are completely confidential, so please be as open and honest as you can. Thank you very much

Section Header: Please use this scale to rate the TB nurse communicated with you.
Field Label: 1. Greeted me in a way that made me feel comfortable.

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 9. Checked to be sure I understood everything.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 11. Involved me in decisions as much as I wanted.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 12. Discussed next steps, including any follow-up plans.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 13. Showed care and concern.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

 1 - 9     : Sub-threshold    (No Referal)

Section Header: Consent forms for 18 and older
Field Label:
Title: Multi-Level and Intersectional Stigma and Other Social Determinant Effects on TB Case Detection, Care, and Treatment Outcomes: The MISSED TB Outcomes Study
Sponsor:  U.S. National Institutes of Health
Co-Principal Investigators: 

Dr Andrew Medina-Marino, PhD, Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF)

Dr. Aaron M. Kipp, PhD, East Carolina University
Address:  Desmond Tutu HIV Centre, University of Cape Town, Faculty of Health Sciences, Anzio Road, Observatory, 7700, Cape Town
Protocol Number:                   543/2020 (Human Research Ethics Committee, University of Cape Town)

 

Informed Consent Form: Household Contacts of TB Index Patients (Cohort 1)


Good morning/afternoon. My name is [user-fullname] and I work for the Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF). We would like to invite you to take part in a study we are doing in collaboration with the Eastern Cape Department of Health. The focus of this study is on tuberculosis (TB), which is a very serious problem in South Africa and the Eastern Cape.


Our study aims to identify and understand how individual and community knowledge, beliefs and social norms influence TB-related care and health outcomes. You have been approached to participate because you are a household contact of someone that has been diagnosed with TB, and you yourself have signs and symptoms of TB.


This consent form contains details about the study and what will be expected of you if you agree to participate. Before you agree to take part in the study, you should fully understand why this study is being done. I will go through this consent form with you, and make sure that you understand what the study is all about. If there is anything that you do not understand, please ask me to stop and I will explain it to you. If you have any other questions related to this study, please feel free to ask me.

PURPOSE OF THE STUDY
We are conducting the survey for two main reasons:
1. To identify and understand how individual and community knowledge, beliefs and social norms influence TB-related care and health outcomes

2. To inform possible ways to improve TB and TB/HIV health outcomes among those with TB or TB/HIV

STUDY PROCEDURES
If you agree to participate, you will first be asked to sign this consent form or make your thumb print mark to show that you are willing to take part in the study. After you agree to be part of our study, we will work with you to create a map and set of directions to your house. We will also create a detailed list of who lives with you, their contact information, and days that they can usually be found at home. After which, we will schedule a time and day that works best with your household contacts to visit them and screen them for TB. If they screen positive then we will also invite them to participate in the study.

CONFIDENTIALITY
Your participation in this study will be kept confidential. We will not tell anyone about your participation; we will make every effort to protect your privacy, confidentiality, answers, and information. Your household information will be stored either on a secure, password protected computer, or in a cabinet that will be kept locked at all times in our study office. We will identify you and your household using a special number that will be assigned to you by a computer. Only authorised research staff will know what your special number is or be able to see your information. After these five years, any personal identifying information you provide will be destroyed.

RISKS, BENEFITS, AND COSTS TO YOU
We understand that by visiting your home, you may feel the need to disclose your TB status to your household contacts. If you are taking this opportunity to disclose your status for the first time, we are aware that this may be a difficult conversation. This may cause you stress, and may even be stigmatizing. If this happens, please tell us immediately so that we can provide you with support and counselling. If we cannot provide you with the support you need, we will refer you to someone who can.

Although you will not directly benefit from participating, your household members will benefit from free TB screening. If anyone in your household screens positive for signs and symptoms of TB, we will immediately refer them to the clinic for testing. Participation in this study will involve no cost to you, and you will not be paid to participate in this study. If you decide to not participate, your care or the care of your household members will not be affected.

WITHDRAWAL FROM THE STUDY
Participation in this survey is voluntary, you do not need to participate if you do not want to. You can choose to not have the study team visit your house during the time leading up to the scheduled visits. You can still go to the clinic for services regardless of if you participate.

PROBLEMS OR QUESTIONS
If you ever have any questions or experience harm because of the study, please contact the Study Investigator Dr. Andrew Medina-Marino at 0826373793 or andrew.marino@hiv-research.org.za.  This research has been approved by the University of Cape Town Human Research Ethics Committee (an independent committee established to help protect the rights of research participants). If you have any concerns about the way the study is being carried out, you may contact the committee chair, Dr. Marc Blockman, on 021 650 4015 or marc.blockman@uct.ac.za.  

DECLARATION TO PARTICIPATE


By signing below, I [hhcl_member_name] [hhcl_member_surname] consent voluntarily to participate in the study entitled: "Multi-Level and Intersectional Stigma and Other Social Determinant Effects on TB Case Detection, Care, and Treatment Outcomes: The MISSED TB Outcomes Study"

I declare that:
1) I have read this consent form or had it read to me.
2) I understand the aims of the research and have had an opportunity to ask questions.
3) I understand what my involvement in the study will entail and agree to participate.
4) I understand that I do not have to give any information that I am not comfortable sharing.
5) I understand that I can withdraw from the study at any point if I feel the need to.
6) By signing this form, I do not give up any rights that I have as a study participant.

Section Header: SECTION 9: PATIENT/PROVIDER COMMUNICATION
Field Label:
RA Instruction:

Communication with patients is a very important part of quality medical care. We would like to know how you feel about the way your TB nurse communicated with you. Your answers are completely confidential, so please be as open and honest as you can. Thank you very much

Section Header: Please use this scale to rate the TB nurse communicated with you.
Field Label: 1. Greeted me in a way that made me feel comfortable.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 2. Treated me with respect.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 3. Showed interest in my ideas about my health.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 4. Understood my health concerns.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 5. Paid attention to me (looked at me, listened carefully)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 6. Let me talk without interruptions.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 7. Gave me as much information as I wanted.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 8. Talked in terms I could understand.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 9. Checked to be sure I understood everything.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 10. Encouraged me to ask questions.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 11. Involved me in decisions as much as I wanted.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 12. Discussed next steps, including any follow-up plans.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 13. Showed care and concern.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent

Field Label: 14. Spent the right amount of time with me.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Poor | 2, Fair | 3, Good |4, Very Good |5, Excellent
